customize.name: Xianyun
customize.desc: One of the Mighty and Illuminated Adepti of Jueyun, known as "Cloud Retainer." Expert in all kinds of mechanical contraptions, her heart now turns towards the affairs of the mortal world, through which she walks under the name "Xianyun."

customize.text: Ganyu and Cloud Retainer share a close bond. However, Cloud Retainer would frequently reminisce about Ganyu's childhood to others, much to the latter's embarrassment.

<color=#ffd780>October 2, 2021</color>
The passing of time is marked by meals as we drink and make merry, blessed by nature's grace. From past to present, the years go by in the blink of an eye. Smoke of hearths brings us joy and domesticity paints a picture of everyday life. Delicate clouds chase the moon as the boat floats on the river of time.

<color=#ffd780>December 30, 2021</color>
Since childhood, Shenhe has lived in seclusion in the mountains, studying under an adeptus and practicing diligently day by day.
Occasionally, the leaves rustle, birds sing, and insects chirp, as if a new guest is visiting.
But when she listened closely, the mountain seemed lonely and lush, and not even the wind made a sound. All was silent.

customize.name: Yaoyao
customize.desc: Streetward Rambler's youngest disciple. A gentle and caring "little adult."

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Yuegui</color>
Streetward Rambler has acquaintances all across Liyue, and even early on, she had paid many of them a visit, saying that her newest disciple's training was not quite complete yet, and asking them to take care of the young girl should they encounter her.
Her original intention was simply to introduce her student and ask that they help teach Yaoyao further, that her eventual learning might increase.
Yaoyao's clever and caring manner, however, proved more lovable than Streetward Rambler had expected, and Cloud Retainer would take the request to heart.
Before either master or pupil had realized it, Cloud Retainer had already completed the creation of a wondrous machine rabbit.
"Well then, Yaoyao, one purposes to give this to you. Should you encounter any danger, call upon it, and it shall answer."
Yaoyao was very taken with this cute rabbit, naming it Yuegui and taking it everywhere with her.
Having given this gift, Cloud Retainer would seek out the little girl's master to say, and not without pride, that:
"One should inform you first that this device has another function. Should you ever be unable to find Yaoyao, you need only call out, 'Yuegui!', and her location shall be made known to you."
"Nonetheless, one counsels you not to overuse this feature, for when the child grows older, she will desire her own privacy, and may yet take umbrage to your constant calling upon her. Now, take one's loose relationship with one's pupil Shenhe for example..."
"Oh, not to worry. I understand, Cloud Retainer."
"And it is good that you do. In any case, Yuegui shall alert us if anyone should try to do her ill without our knowledge — any such churls shall soon need all the luck they can get."
<color=#ffd780>Vision</color>
"Why did I receive a Vision?"
This question troubled Yaoyao quite a bit in the days that directly followed her receiving one.
Did the gods want to reward her for the good deeds she had done? Or was this because she had been a good and respectful pupil?
Speaking of which, her senior Xiangling and Aunty Cloud Retainer's student Shenhe both had Visions as well. So, was this because the gods recognized the adepti, and so they would, as a matter of course, also extend this acknowledgment to an adeptus' students?
But on further consideration, none of these guesses really made much sense.
It was with a sigh that Yaoyao found herself sitting on the slopes behind Liyue Harbor, hugging a dog that had followed her up the incline.
This was hardly the first thing she had found incomprehensible since leaving her parents' side, and she had, by and large, decided that her doubts were unavoidable, and could wait till she got older, for surely they might clear up by then!
But since she now had a Vision, an item that represented divine acknowledgment, she could not betray such hopes.
As a disciple of her master, she would follow her example and protect the people. This meant that she would not only have to care for her master and senior disciple, but also extend care to her family and friends, and extend universal love to all people. Ah, she still had such a long way to go. Nothing for it, then — she'd hang on for a bit longer during spear practice tomorrow, and write one extra page into her calligraphy copybook too.
Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>More About Yaoyao: IV</color>
There are adepti everywhere in Liyue. I've met loads of them! Aunty Cloud Retainer, Uncle Mountain Shaper... But Aunty Cloud Retainer's my favorite! She's given me all kinds of adepti gadgets, and taught me all about how to use them. I've learned so much from her!

customize.text: Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>About Shenhe</color>
I actually don't know her all that well — I've only heard bits and pieces from Cloud Retainer. From what I've heard, she can be quite ferocious. Whenever her temper gets the better of her, she is likely to start obliterating her surroundings. I wonder if maybe she's just... bored. Should... Should I recommend some work to keep her occupied?

customize.name: Shenhe
customize.desc: An adepti disciple with a most unusual air about her. Having spent much time cultivating in isolation in Liyue's mountains, she has become every bit as cool and distant as the adepti themselves.

customize.text: Character Story

<color=#ffd780>Character Details</color>
Shenhe was originally from a branch family of exorcists, but due to a series of coincidences, she became the disciple of an adeptus.
She is a student solely of Cloud Retainer in name, but her impressive constitution and intelligence quickly won several other adepti over.
She would go on to learn from them all, eventually becoming a master of adeptal arts in her own right as a mortal.
She very much looks the part as well in her unique temperament and manner of carrying herself — indeed, it would be no understatement to name her a true adeptus upon meeting her for the first time.
However, it is precisely due to the long years of tutelage that she has lacked company save for the adepti and odd passing illuminated beast.
This isolation has caused her to grow distant and indifferent.
<color=#ffd780>Character Story 2</color>
Shenhe is in all likelihood the least accustomed to mortal life amongst those who take on an adeptal appearance.
Having been sequestered in the mountains since a young age, she lacks experience and common sense, which makes it difficult for her to relate to people normally.
To ordinary people, there are many solutions to any given problem. But to Shenhe, any solution that is not the simplest and most direct one may as well not exist.
For example, she almost never considers "negotiation" as a solution to being at cross-purposes with others, mostly resorting to "threats" instead. After all, it is simple and efficacious. A good solution, no?
She has also spent much time ruminating on problems that are truly esoteric.
For example: Why do we need to pay for food?
Is there any difference between intimidating civilians and intimidating bandits?
She even truly believes that her master, Cloud Retainer, is a most brilliant and eloquent conversationalist.
In a certain sense, she can be considered very pure.
Much like a child, she relies on her chaotic yet straightforward intuition and logic to get her through life.
Mountain Shaper once had this to say about her:
"Little Shenhe is not only stronger than most — she also possesses a unique character."
"She knows not the world, understands not common sense, distinguishes few cuisines, and acknowledges no hierarchies."
"It may not be such an easy thing for Cloud Retainer to tutor her."
<color=#ffd780>Character Story 3</color>
Liyue has no lack of folktales about meetings with the adepti, and many of these concern relative nobodies whom an adeptus took under their wing, thus elevating them greatly.
However, the circumstances under which Shenhe's fate became tied to the adeptal abodes was no such glorious thing. If anything, it was an experience characterized by anguish.
When she was five, her mother passed away, and her father, having loved his wife dearly, found that agony hard to bear.
Over time, this agony turned into resentment, and this resentment birthed obsession, by which he was driven wandering throughout the land like a man gone mad.
He left for close to a year, never stopping, never able to sleep soundly, ever searching for some technique that might bring his wife back.
At last, when the year was almost out, he returned in joyous frenzy.
Her father had brought with him a secret art known as "Fate Transference"—
By making a ritual sacrifice to the seelie summoned by this art, a living person's body could be exchanged for a dead one's life.
At that time, Shenhe was yet utterly unaware of the disaster that would befall. She was only an ordinary child, overjoyed at her long-absent father's return.
He claimed that he had a surprise awaiting her in a cave in the mountains behind and that he would take her there immediately. She was ecstatic...
But the scene that followed would be burned into her mind forever.
Her father summoned that hideous, horrifying black "seelie" into that cave, its blood-red eyes craving her delectable life-force.
Stupefied, Shenhe knew not from whence it had come, nor what it wanted from this place.
Crises often paralyze people. One thought only, however, crept into the young Shenhe's mind.
This creature wanted to eat her, but she did not want to die. She wanted to live!
Gripping her mother's keepsake, an exorcism dagger, she faced that dark "seelie," trembling yet resolute...
Several days later, an adeptus following the trail of great evil would investigate the cave, only to find the little girl collapsed inside — spent, famished, parched, her life hanging by a thread.
Taking pity on the lass' ruinous fate, and seeing that she possessed great talent, having repelled some terrifying force on her own, the adeptus would bring her back, heal her, and instruct her in the adeptal path.
If not for that, Shenhe would not be as she is today.
<color=#ffd780>White Jade Comb</color>
Once upon a time, Shenhe had a full head of black hair.
When she was first brought to Mt. Hulao, she would not say a word. The only thing she proved willing to do was to climb the mountain and watch the sea of clouds.
It was well, however, that she would sleep when tired, drink the dew of the mountains when thirsty, and would chew on a few stalks of Qingxin when hungry.
Cloud Retainer took this all in, but did not disturb the girl, instead making this comb of white jade from a sacred stone and giving it to her.
The adeptus said that if she ever wished to sever her ties with the mortal world and enter adeptal tutelage, she should brush her hair thrice with this comb, and it would be counted as a rite of apprenticeship.
Shenhe did exactly as the adeptus said without any hesitation. And something strange happened then — for as the jade comb brushed through Shenhe's hair once, a layer of her black locks turned a frosty silver from root to tip.
On the second brush, but half her hair remained dark.
When the process was complete, only a flowing curtain of snow remained.
...
Today, Shenhe still keeps this comb on her person as a symbol of her connection to the adepti.
Through her years of training, she has long since come to understand the meaning behind those three brush strokes:
The first to uproot useless anxiety, the second to forsake joy and sorrow, and the third to walk this path into old age without regret.
Voice-Overs

<color=#ffd780>When the Wind Is Blowing</color>
Yes... This reminds me of Master. She loves to ride the swift winds of Qingyun Peak.
<color=#ffd780>About Us: Red Ropes</color>
My master gave me these red ropes in order to restrain my impulses. But during our journey together, I feel I have finally grasped the key to all of this. Somehow, controlling my strength — knowing when to restrain myself, and when to unleash — it comes more naturally to me now. I think that what saves me from myself is not my red ropes... but you. If you understand what that means to me, please stay by my side.
<color=#ffd780>About Ningguang</color>
I have no use for the wealth that ordinary people desire. But in the hands of Lady Ningguang, wealth becomes a means of solving complex issues of the kind that no weapons could ever hope to resolve. She understands the unwritten rules of human society, she knows what's in people's hearts... Master once told me that even the adepti aren't able to achieve this. I hold her and her work in high regard.
<color=#ffd780>About Ganyu</color>
I've heard many stories about her from my master. She's really quite different from how I originally imagined her... But don't worry, I'll be keeping this to myself. Speaking of Ganyu, her work in Liyue Harbor is unbelievably busy... It seems that there is a price to pay for those who want to integrate into the mortal world.
<color=#ffd780>About Zhongli</color>
That gentleman claims to be a mortal, yet is very familiar with my master, who is an adeptus. Master once said: "If you see him drinking on a stone stool in front of my abode, do not disturb him. Let him sit quietly for a while." And that's precisely what I did.
Adepti

Long before the Archon War, when
had not yet received a Gnosis, he, along with other Gods and Adepti, founded Liyue and Guili Assembly. Guizhong, the God of Dust, imparted her wisdom along with her skill to craft machinery onto humanity. Marchosius, the God of Stove, gave people the knowledge of cooking and creating ovens. Together with other Adepti, they defended their people.
A long, long time ago, before the Archon War, there was a severe drought in Liyue. Left with no choice, many people left their homes, while others spent day and night praying to the Adepti. On top of the drought, a noxious gas also began to spread through the land. If not for Cloud Retainer's efforts, much of Liyue would be nothing more than a barren wasteland today. Upon arrival, the Adeptus borrowed the wind to retain the clouds. Immediately, the clouds gathered together, and abundant rain burst forth from the heavens. Drought and plague were both driven away, and the people of Liyue were saved.

In those distant times, Cloud Retainer loved to have tea parties with other Adepti. There is a table near her abode, where Rex Lapis, the God of Dust, and Cloud Retainer herself sat. Cloud Retainer often laughed at the cups that Rex Lapis brought because they were too square. She was also friends with Fujin and Herblord, the Adepti of the north, who served another goddess.
Guizhong, Cloud Retainer's friend, also often held meetings in the Guili Assembly, reserving seats around the largest stone table for them. Marchosius would bring his delectable dishes to the table, Sea Gazer would always bring out his latest treasure, and Cloud Retainer and Guizhong would discuss their latest inventions. Streetward Rambler would often remain to admire the flowers with Guizhong before returning to her own abode. Guizhong would always find topics for conversation, filling the table with humor and laughter.
Once Moon Carver and Cloud Retainer participated in a race. After Moon Carver lost, he insisted that Cloud Retainer's ability to fly gave her a natural edge in such a contest. She agreed to forgo flying in return for being able to use one of her devices, "Bi-Cyclical Thunderflash-Mobile," in the race. Thanks to the Adeptal energy, the mobile could travel up thousands of miles in one day, but its weakness was against mountainous terrain. As Cloud Retainer overtook Moon Carver, the device went off the track a few seconds before the finish line, resulting in the defeat of the race. Another time, it snowed heavily in Liyue, and Mt. Aocang was covered in several feet of snow. Cloud Retainer created a Snowdrift Mechanism for skiing in the mountains. Together with Guizhong and Streetward Rambler, she had a tremendous time, until Moon Carver decided to join in. Moments later, he had managed to send the mechanism flying off the rails and plummeted deep into a snowbank. It took them hours to dig him up.

When the Archon War began, Liyue's lands became a battlefield. The Guili Assembly was flooded, and the Adepti helped the inhabitants move to Liyue Harbor, which later became the main city. Cloud Retainer lost many of her friends to this war. Marchosius sacrificed himself for the people, losing his powers and memory and turning into Guoba. Guizhong was killed and her powers were sealed. Skybracer sacrificed his antlers to support a collapsing mountain, ensuring the safety of villagers, and kept on fighting until his blood was drained and his life ran out. In the Sea of Liyue, stone lances, thrown by Morax, formed the Guyun Stone Forest, where the defeated Archons were buried and sealed.
Many legends are told about the feats of Cloud Retainer during the Archon War. One legend says that the surviving mortals, who had lost everything in the tumult, fled to the mountains, and there they begged the Adepti for shelter. They were pursued by countless monsters who had long since lost their senses. After several days of fierce battle, with everything hanging in the balance, some say, Cloud Retainer burst from the clouds like a descending gale. She turned the tide and defeated the monsters. There are other versions of this legend, but in each legend, Cloud Retainer heroically saved the people of Liyue.

customize.text: Mechanisms

Cloud Retainer loves to create and study various mechanisms. In her abode, many riddles and puzzles can be found. She loves to compete with other Adepti in the mastery of her inventions. Once Sea Gazer brought out his treasures during their meeting, they would predictably become the center of attention. Neither Guizhong nor Cloud Retainer was content to let him just steal the spotlight, so they would then also present their proudest mechanical creations. Sea Gazer hadn't invented anything himself, he just used his exploration skills to dig them out of the ground, so Cloud Retainer found it outrageous that he was trying to compete with her. As a result, she often quarreled with Sea Gazer. Guizhong often tried to distract them from arguing by saying that neither of them could ever hope to beat her or suggesting going to the foot of the mountain and grilling some meat.

In times gone by, Cloud Retainer often quarreled with Guizhong concerning mechanical principles. Both of them had their ideals, and neither would yield under the pretext of a social gathering. Once, Cloud Retainer invited the impartial Rex Lapis to judge the quality of their creations. But Rex Lapis declared that Guizhong's Obscuro Vulpes Mechanism was superior. Although Cloud Retainer was too proud to acknowledge it, in her heart, she knew that Guizhong was indeed the superior talent in the mechanical arts.
One of the known mechanisms made by Cloud Retainer is Yuegui, a mechanical rabbit that she created for Yaoyao. It was supposed to protect the girl in case of danger, and her master, Streetward Rambler, could find out the location of her student by calling Yuegui. If someone wanted to harm the girl, the rabbit would inform her master so that the Adepti could help her. Other devices are the Supreme Cuisine Machine and Cloud Retainer's Damasked Device. Made from stacked paper, the lightweight Damasked Device has the appearance of a bird and was gifted to the Traveler. While it may be called a "device," you cannot see any traditional mechanical components here. For the Qiaoying Village, famous for its tea, Cloud Retainer made a special cauldron for preparing tea, working with the help of elemental energy.

Cloud Retainer also created the "Suspensus Somnium Mechanism" — a special device that uses a special Adeptal tune to help the listener subconsciously relax, sooth agitation and anxiety, relieve exhaustion and insomnia, and recover the lost memories.

Another Cloud Retainer's invention was the mechanical Onikabuto. She initially made a lot of gardening and landscaping machines for her friend Madame Ping to look after the Silk Flowers on the terrace and called them Bloom Pruners. The Bloom Pruner can transform into the shape of any creature to blend into its environment. When Madame Ping learned that her old friend Guoba was participating in the Arataki Beetle Brawl, she gave Guoba a Bloom Pruner and got it to take the form of an Onikabuto. During the battle with Arataki Itto's Crimson Staff, the Bloom Pruner showed such skill using only one-thousandth of his strength that Itto wanted to become a disciple of Cloud Retainer in order to learn such skill.

When Itto returned to Inazuma, his friend from the Bettle Battle, Grandmaster Hanakado, remained in Liyue and began preparing suitable gifts to study with the Adepti. Cloud Retainer saw the boy and decided that her young disciple, Shuyu, should spend more time with people her own age. While walking along Liyue Harbor, she noticed that Shuyu's peers had friends with whom they could have fun in their free time. But Mt. Aocang is not a bustling city of mortals, there are no children her age nearby, and so there was sometimes a concern that she was suffering from loneliness. The Adeptus had only recently taught the girl about the principles of mechanics, so Hanakado's training would allow her to consolidate her knowledge better. Cloud Retainer designed a second mechanical Onikabuto and a special subspace in the teapot — an annex of an Adeptal realm that she split off to improve Bloom Pruner's gardening functions. The monsters inside are all targets created using Adeptal energy and act in set ways similar to those of the creatures they're based on.
In addition to creating mechanisms, Cloud Retainer likes to study and disassemble existing ones. One day, during the Lantern Rite Festival, Keqing gave the Adeptus a new firework designed by the Ministry of Civil Affairs. Cloud Retainer was delighted with the gift since it was a device with an original design, aesthetically pleasing to the eye.

customize.text: Death of Rex Lapis

3700 years ago, Adepti entered into a contract with Rex Lapis and promised to protect Liyue Harbor. For millennia they looked after Liyue until they moved away from control after the death of the Geo Archon.
When the Geo Archon was killed during the Rite of Descension, Cloud Retainer wanted to destroy the entire Liyue Harbor. She believed that after the death of the Archon, terrible events would follow, from which she wanted to free people. She believed that Liyue Qixing, who ruled Liyue, failed in their task and allowed the death of the Archon.

Cloud Retainer nevertheless agreed to first listen to the opinions of other Adepti. Once Rex Lapis came to them in a dream, the Adepti decided to temporarily reconcile with Liyue Qixing to protect people from the threat. Osial, Overlord of the Vortex was defeated by Morax during the Archon War, and then summoned by the Harbinger of Fatui Childe in hopes of luring out Rex Lapis and obtaining his Gnosis. Cloud Retainer modified the Guizhong Ballista to turn it into an engine of war. Through the joint efforts of the Milleliths, Liyue Qixing, and the Adepti, the ancient god was stopped, and Liyue was saved.
After this battle, the Adepti completely entrusted the reign to Liyue Qixing. When Osial's wife, Beisht, wanted to attack Liyue again to avenge her husband, they no longer interfered and allowed the people to defend the city themselves.

customize.text: Disciples

One of Cloud Retainer's first disciples is Ganyu, in whose veins flows the blood of the divine beast Qilin. Ganyu was born several thousand years ago, and Cloud Retainer has known her since childhood. When Ganyu was little, Cloud Retainer would take her in her arms if she had nightmares, stroke her horns if she couldn't sleep, and make her various toys. Although Ganyu has grown up a long time ago and has enormous powers herself, her Master is always worried about her health.

More than 50 years ago, a snow-white crane lived on Mt. Aocang. For many years she bathed in the soft breeze and drank the sweet dew of the mountains, and one day she gained wisdom and sentience. Cloud Retainer became aware of her existence and began to share many stories with her, making her a disciple, telling her many amazing stories, and passing on the secret of cultivation. Crane thought that hard training would help her become an Adeptus, but one day she heard about how her Master saved Liyue from a terrible drought, and she also wanted to perform a feat to become like Cloud Retainer. Then she could not change her appearance, but the Master, having learned about her dream, prepared a special Human Mimicry Potion to give her disciple a human appearance for ten years. So the crane became a human, receiving the name Yuandai. Ten years later, she had to return to her real appearance so as not to lose her memory and not turn into an incomprehensible entity, neither human, beast, nor Adeptus, but Yuandai met her love and decided to remain human. When her time was up, she became very ill and lost her memory, but Cloud Retainer made her a special potion from her blood to eliminate the symptoms.
When 50 years later Yuandai lost her memory again, Cloud Retainer met with her and her granddaughter, Shuyu, and helped her regain her memories. In order to prevent Yuandai from turning into a monster, the Adeptus returned her to the form of a crane and took Shuyu as her disciple. Now Cloud Retainer is teaching the girl the principles of the Adeptal and mortal mechanical arts so that she can earn a good living if she wants to live in Liyue Harbor.

Another of Cloud Retainer's disciples is Shenhe. When Shenhe was five, her mother passed away, and her father, having loved his wife dearly, found that agony hard to bear. He found a secret art known as "Fate Transference" — by making a ritual sacrifice to the Seelie summoned by this art, a living person's body could be exchanged for a dead one's life. He wanted to exchange the life of Shenhe for his wife's life. He then brought her into the cave and summoned a hideous, horrifying black "Seelie" into that cave, its blood-red eyes craving her delectable life force.

Several days later, Cloud Retainer followed the trail of great evil and investigated a cave, only to find a little girl collapsed inside — spent, famished, parched, her life hanging by a thread. Taking pity on the lass' ruinous fate, and seeing that she possessed great talent, having repelled some terrifying force on her own, Cloud Retainer would bring her back, heal her, and instruct her in the Adeptal path.
When Adepti first brought Shenhe to Mt. Hulao, she would not say a word. The only thing she proved willing to do was to climb the mountain and watch the sea of clouds. Cloud Retainer took this all in but did not disturb the girl, instead making a comb of white jade from a sacred stone and giving it to her. The Adeptus said that if she ever wished to sever her ties with the mortal world and enter Adeptal tutelage, she should brush her hair thrice with this comb, and it would be counted as a rite of apprenticeship. Shenhe did exactly as the Adeptus said without any hesitation, and her black hair turned frosty silver. Through her years of training, she has long since come to understand the meaning behind those three brush strokes: the first to uproot useless anxiety, the second to forsake joy and sorrow, and the third to walk this path into old age without regret.

Many years have passed since Shenhe was saved, and the Adeptus has become her only family. Cloud Retainer not only teaches her student the knowledge of the Adepti but also takes care of her as if she was her daughter.
Although Cloud Retainer greatly misses Yuandai, Shenhe, and Ganyu, the Adeptus understands that she needs to let them go.

<color=#ffffffd9>"When it is time for one's progeny to leave the nest, it is the responsibility of an elder to let them fly free. Yet when your wings grow weary and the night grows dark, just know that you always have a place to which to return."</color>

customize.text: Personality

At first sight, Cloud Retainer does not like the company of people and prefers to spend time alone, creating and studying various mechanisms in her abode. She can sometimes be abrupt and rude to strangers. But if you get to know her better, it turns out that she loves to talk, especially about Ganyu, a half-human, half-Qilin whom Cloud Retainer has known since Ganyu's childhood. Cloud Retainer loves to tell stories about little Ganyu when she was chubby and couldn't sleep unless her horns were stroked. Despite her harshness, Cloud Retainer cares for her fellow Adepti, whom she likes to call fossils, as well as Ganyu, her disciple Shenhe, and Streetward Rambler's disciple Yaoyao. She asks those around them and themselves to look out for each other. Ganyu even personally introduced Shenhe to her employer, Chef Mao from Wanmin Restaurant.
Cloud Retainer often pretends that she does not need the company and that she can talk to herself for days on end and not get bored. In fact, sometimes she gets very lonely. Nearly all her dear friends who once laughed by her side have perished in the raging fires of the Archon War. Sometimes, the emptiness inside her is quite overwhelming. And though her companions sacrificed themselves willingly in defense of the world, she cannot help but lament their passing. Cloud Retainer also misses her disciples who live in Liyue Harbor. The Adepti often expects them to visit and is afraid to visit herself, so as not to create inconvenience at work.

customize.text: Present Day

At one of the Lantern Rite Festivals, Cloud Retainer became interested in the lifestyle of Streetward Rambler, who went to live with people after the Archon War. Cloud Retainer wanted to spend more time with Madame Ping, so the latter suggested moving to the city: <color=#ffffffd9>"There are plenty of people here to talk to. I think you would find it quite the antidote to the monotony of solitude. And if you looked around, I suspect you would find some young minds with an interest in the mechanical arts — some of them even worth training."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Perhaps, as dust settles after a storm, we too must one day return to the world below."</color>

Cloud Retainer wondered why her disciples preferred to live in Liyue Harbor, where there were so many people, and even considered herself a bad Master. When she took on her new disciple Shuyu, she decided to try living among people in Luyue Harbor. Cloud Retainer chose the name Xianyun.

<color=#ffffffd9>"An adeptus of years past would rise with the clouds and rest with the moon. They were enlightened and wise, free and unfettered. The writer referenced Master's name to describe her carefree and spontaneous nature."</color>

Xianyun understands mechanisms and also specializes in creating all kinds of little trinkets. At the moment, Cloud Retainer is hard at work creating the Exquisite Mini Broth Pot and asks her not to disturb her while she is busy.
